channel.title: Help please?
channel.description: hey i need help adding models to my server if you have team viewer it would be a massive help i will ++rep you or you can post picture by picture minimal writing please thanks ahead :P

item.title: Help please?
item.dc:creator: @GODYLSCAPE GODYLSCAPE
item.description:
@GODYLSCAPE wrote:

I don’t think you can even rep with 9 rep
But if your using Project Insanity than you should add this into itemdef.java in your client file

switch (itemDef.id) { case #####: itemDef.modelid = #####; itemDef.name = "Item Name"; itemDef.description = "Item Description"; itemDef.modelZoom = ####; itemDef.modelRotationY = ###; itemDef.modelRotationX = ###; itemDef.modelOffset1 = ###; itemDef.modelOffset2 = ###; itemDef.anInt165 = #####; itemDef.anInt200 = #####; itemDef.groundActions = new String[5]; itemDef.groundActions[2] = "Take"; itemDef.itemActions = new String[5]; itemDef.itemActions[1] = ""; itemDef.itemActions[2] = ""; itemDef.itemActions[4] = ""; break;

This is what you want your item number to be
add this into your item.cfg if you wish to spawn it or give it stats

This is the model number of the .dat that you have made in your modeling thing
If you don’t know how to make models in .dat format than you need to download a datmaker and open a metaseq file with it
Here is the link for the datmaker I used to use http://server250.uppit.com/files/6/u26xbbl3y64ors/DatMaker.rar

This is what you want it to say when you examine it

This is just the name you want your item to be

There a simple model adding snippet for ya you can deal with zooming and rotations
I am terrible with that stuff

Read full topic
